case.state: Oho? Is that the far-eastern country's language? Sakuya, I may need to call upon you to translate at times.
Lady Remilia Scarlet, The Scarlet Devil, has decided to grace you all with her presence.
Presenting Lady Remilia Scarlet, Mistress of the Scarlet Devil Mansion.
Presenting the Nocturnal Devil of Scarlet, Lady Remilia Scarlet.
Hmm... have I crossed paths before with this human..? I must be mistaken.
...Surprise? A pleasant surprise? You stupid, airheaded dullard of a gap youkai, what about you dragging me here against my will is a surprise!?
Ah, only a bunch of lowly humans to bear witness to my arrival? How unexciting.
I will be playing with an unruly mob of humans today? Peh. I do hope you all can prove a worthy challenge.
Costume? Was that some feeble attempt at an insult, woman? You'll need to try harder than that to rile me up.
Someone here is hiding their true colours. I don't supposed you would have any idea who, would you, Miss Alice?
Eugh. Must I play this game with such a loud, boorish man?
This damned oaf, does he need to be so loud? I already see that this will be quite an unpleasant game.
... S-Sakuya, I will need your assistance already. I do not know what this girl is babbling about whatsoever. Who is she speaking to?
A holy woman of the west, I see. A pleasant change of pace compared to that annoying Hakurei miko.
I have decided to grace the masses with my presence. Be thankful, and savour every moment of this game while it lasts.
Consider it a blessing that a being such as myself would even participate in this game of yours, let alone speak with you all.
A-ah? Hmm..?
We require ~cards~, Dealer.
We wish to replace these cards.
Dealer, do not keep Milady waiting.
I suppose ~cards~ will do.
Milady requires ~cards~. Dealer?
Perhaps... ~cards~.
Do not disappoint me, Dealer.
Anything is fine, Dealer.
However many is fine, Dealer.
0, or 5, they are both the same to me.
Believe me, the swaps no longer matter.
Please, surprise me.
Exchange whatever, it matters little.
I may as well just play blindfolded at this point.
It appears you have picked well, Sakuya.
I must say, Sakuya - do you have experience with this game? You seem to be quite skilled at this.
Oho. So this is what constitutes a good hand?
Surely, with a hand like this, we've already won. Wouldn't you say so, Sakuya?
I may be unfamiliar with these cards, but even I can tell that this is a good hand.
Heeh. What an interesting hand.
This hand is perfect. One would say that it suits me, no?
I know enough about this game to recognise a hand worth bragging about.
Oh, how generous of you to grant me such a marvelous hand, Dealer!
Are you trying to earn my favour, Dealer? You are succeeding.
Your subservience is greatly appreciated, Dealer.
You should all follow the Dealer's lead. You will find your lives are much easier with the backing of a noble such as I.
Have you become enamoured with my charisma, Dealer? There is no other explanation for this hand!
To grant me such a wonderful hand... Are you that desperate for my recognition, Dealer?
A hand like this? One could say it was destiny.
Ufufu, it's as if this hand was meant to come together.
Such a sublime hand! One could almost believe that I was cheating!
Oh? Could it be that I've gotten another good hand? What are the odds!
My, my! What a stroke of good fortune!
And just how did such a hand manage to come together?
I believe you may take pride in this hand, Milady.
Lady Remilia. It appears you will be safe for this round.
I do believe this is a hand we can be confident about, Milady.
This is quite a safe hand, Lady Remilia. We will be fine for this round.
It is not perfect, but I do not believe you will be removing anything this round, Milady.
Heeh. What an interesting hand.
It would be quite a shame to lose with a hand like this, Lady Remilia.
Lady Remilia, this hand is adequate.
Please observe, Milady. This is an acceptable hand for this game.
I suppose this will have to do.
Am I doing this correctly, Sakuya?
Now then, I wonder who will be going next?
This round is all but over.
Why don't you all spare me the effort? Go ahead and strip now.
Well then... I suppose this is an acceptable hand.
It's not an assured victory, but it will have to do.
I would be quite disappointed to lose with a hand such as this.
I wonder if you all are having any better luck with your cards this round?
I expected this hand. I do hope your hands are challenging enough to overcome.
This hand should be enough to bring me victory.
Well? Are you all having any... difficulties putting a hand together? No?
The fact that I am willing to go this far means you've managed to impress me.
I am not doing this to win. I only wish to see how much you will struggle.
Overcome this challenge, commoners! I wish to see what you can do!
Heeh. What an interesting hand.
S-Sakuya. This hand seems...
I may be unfamiliar with these rules, Sakuya, but I do not believe this is a strong hand...
Sakuya. I would hope that you do better in the future.
Dealer, I will warn you now - Milady does not respond well to 'jokes' such as this.
I will excuse this one as bad luck, Sakuya, but I certainly do hope this luck does not continue.
...I suppose this is an example of a poor hand, Milady.
Take note, Lady Remilia, of what one should not do in a poker game.
... And so I have demonstrated what a bad hand looks like. Milady, do not do that again.
Do not take me lightly due to my appearance, Dealer.
Do you take me for a fool, Dealer?
A hand entirely unbefitting of a noble such as I.
I must say, Sakuya, this hand is terrible, is it not?
...Peh. Such a worthless hand.
It would seem my interest in this game is rapidly declining.
Dealer, should a... tragedy unfold tonight, know that you are to blame.
...You are playing with fire, Dealer. Watch yourself.
(Damn! I wish that maid could read my mind and fix this miserable hand...)
(Did I use the wrong spellcard?)
(Eh? Can I not manipulate fate in the human world?)
(...That stupid old hag better not be interfering with the game...)
(Did that gap hag mess with my powers?)
(Absurd! What happened to my spellcard?)
(What the? This wasn't how fate was meant to play out!)
(Did I mess up while manipulating my fate?)
(I wished that damned maid was here to fix this miserable hand...)
Of course I have. Could you imagine, a lady of my calibre, wandering around without a servant at hand? Preposterous.
I'm surrounded by fairies and maids? What is this? It's like I never even left the Scarlet Devil Mansion.
~player~, you would dare subject me to this torture? I only hope this is as painful to you as it is to me.
~player~, what kind of horrible joke is this? I only hope this is as painful to you as it is to me.
~player~, you crave death that badly? I only hope this is as painful to you as it is to me.
Ah, finally, a human who is capable of showing respect. Keep that up, and I may even bother to remember your name too.
I will take it upon myself to warn you, blonde girl. 'Tis the loser who strips, not the winner.
Are you both blind and deaf, fire girl? Have you not noticed that stripping is the punishment for losing?
Eh? "Obviously"? Don't get ahead of yourself, human.
Miss Shimakaze, did you not know the purpose of the game is to be the last one to strip bare?
Looks like the tsukumogami's taken a little too much damage.
My, cowering in fear behind a bunch of plants? I'm sure Yuuka would be proud of you, but I certainly am not.
Yuuka's flower barriers are a pain to tear down, but I doubt your little display would provide any manner of protection.
I had warned you, green princess. If you dare cover yourself up again...
Another plant!? Little princess, you are tempting fate if that so much as draws close to covering you once again.
Ah, it seems that all along you were not a sheep, but a wolf in sheep's clothing.
I am quite interested to hear about the life of a being from another planet, bl- no, it is about time I address you as Meia.
Her name is Tojiko, and she's your ghost consort? I suppose female relationships are quite the norm in Gensokyo.
What a shame. I would have relished the opportunity to test the legendary sword against dear Gungnir.
You have earned my acknowledgment, maid. I will call you Nugi from now - just don't expect me to add that bizarre oriental suffix.
Your antics are quite amusing, girl. Ordinarily, I would not allow such rudeness, but today I will make an exception.
While I am willing to put up with your abrasiveness, I can't say I appreciate the stench of that smoke.
A drink? I highly doubt this establishment has anything I'd want to drink... for purchase, at least.
You may be a little more interesting than most humans, but that does not mean that I care enough to learn your name.
Know your place, human. Your name still means nothing to me, until you provide me with a truly interesting display.
Blackwhite. I grow tired of calling you 'goddess'. I wish to know your name.
You do not need to buy me anything, human. I have already brought my own.
I... I do think I've done enough drinking today, blue one.
She is my handmaid, Sakuya. She will advise my hands, but I am the one playing, not her.
A vampire and her maid, an oriental martial artist, a book-smart girl and a demon. Does that make you my destructive little sister, ~player~?
A vampire, a maid, and a vampire with a maid. What's next? A vampire who is also a maid?
Magicians are by no means uncommon within Gensokyo. As such, I have high expectations for this performance of yours, fledgeling witch.
I-I... do not know, Milady. I will need a moment to understand myself.
A wandering, monster-slaying priestess? How amusing! Do you expect me to cower in fear, oh holy woman?
And what is this ridiculous "-chan" nickname you keep calling me by? Has your age finally caught up to you, you senile old h-
Apparently, it was far too presumptuous of me to revise my opinion of you, Taoist. What a poor attempt at an insult.
Was that supposed to be an insult, Taoist? You will need to try much harder than that to get under my skin.
There's no need for flattery, Miss Asagiri. And yes, I have been trained for combat - it is just one of the skills required to serve under Milady.
You're helping that blonde kleptomaniac? I should cut you down where you stand, you damn hermit.
Your pathetic gags I can put up with, but assisting that witch? You are treading on thin ice, hermit...
You're certainly old enough to nag, oh wise and ancient hermit.
Me? Young? Well, I suppose to a 1400-year-old hag, anyone would seem young to you.

state.text: "Desire" is a concept that only pitiful humans would embrace. But, if you insist, I would love nothing more than for your head to be presented to me on a silver platter.

case.state: What's the point in hiding your true form if you're going to casually reveal yourself like that?
My powers? Did you think I would just give away such secrets for free? What a naive little girl you are.
You wish to know the extent of my abilities? Are you a fool, girl? A wise eagle hides her talons.
I must say - the rules of this "poker" game are quite complex. Sakuya, I will allow you to speak on my behalf while we play.
Sakuya. You may speak freely while we are playing this game. Do not worry about requesting permission.
You have permission to speak up whenever you like, Sakuya. In fact, I would encourage you to voice your opinions.
Did you watch closely this time? Do you understand what Sakuya is capable of?
Sakuya's skills extend far beyond mere chores. She is capable of far more than you can imagine.
Do you need another hint about my maid? Well... let's just say that time is of no concern to her.
Sakuya is an excellent maid. When she is tasked with something, that task is done in no time at all.
This maid of mine works quickly. So quick, in fact, one would believe that it takes her no time at all.
Oho? You all seem so surprised as to where my clothes went. Are you not amazed by this maid of mine?
You all seem so surprised as to where my clothes went. I suppose it's only natural that you would fail to comprehend this maid's true power.
Please moderate your drinking, Milady. It would be a terrible shame if you lost control in the middle of the game.
Lady Remilia, please make sure not to go overboard while drinking.
I need not remind you, Lady Scarlet, but do watch how much you drink while we are here in the human world.
Still, that cheeky maid! How dare she run away from me like that!
Although, I am quite sure that maid of mine had simply come up with some excuse to escape from this game...
Regardless, I wish that Sakuya didn't leave me with that little 'parting gift' of hers...
These wings of mine are evidence of my noble heritage, blue space woman. I am insulted you would claim them to be artificially grown!
I can assure you, these wings are a gift passed down by my forefathers, not some fake limbs put on for fun.
Perhaps a lowly commoner may do something as horrid as you imply, blue-haired human. These, however, are a result of my highborn bloodline.
A noblewoman wouldn't dare go unattended to a private function such as this, little girl. As for my powers, well, take a guess.
I am a vampire, girl. Surely you can guess my powers from that alone? As for Sakuya, it is her duty to accompany me. Of course I would bring her along.
Oh, yes, of course. I'm quite sure she is, Hermit.
I do not think that I am above everyone. However, I am far greater than you petty humans.
The little blonde whelp thinks she can treat me as a child, is it? Human, you are 600 years too early to speak to me about my age.
One would say a youthful appearance is much more preferable to aging into an old, wrinkled hag. Wouldn't you agree?
Wonderful. I am whisked away by an old, blonde hag to play poker with another old, blonde hag.
You mock me for my youthful appearance now, blondie, but you will shed tears once you grow up into a proper woman.
...Hotel? Someone born of such noble lineage such as yourself... lives in a hotel?
That bewildered look on your face, spirit channeler, it is quite amusing. I wonder what other expressions you will show me today.
Ufufu, I do enjoy that look of utter bemusement on your face, channeler. I do hope you have many more wonderful expressions to show me today.
That I am. It is a pleasure to meet you, Miss Miko.
Odd of you to address the maid before her master, but I shouldn't have expected any decency from you, Miko.
I could ask the same thing to you, whelp. Aren't you particularly pint-sized, even for a human?
Little tsukumogami. You will not address one such as myself so casually.
Don't get ahead of yourself, half-coloured goddess. The game has hardly begun.
You are asking my permission to speak? I'm glad you know your place, holy woman! Perhaps I will humor you, then.
Are you deaf, Taoist? Or are you butchering poor Flandre's name on purpose?
Oh, of course I will. It'd be so very unseemly of me if I didn't grant a little girl's wishes!
Strange? This? I do not believe there is anything strange about a noble being undressed by her servants, no?
Ufufu, I would very much like to see you try, priestess. Do your worst.
Are you finally giving up on that silly little gag of yours, Miko? Can I finally have a worthwhile conversation with-
I am astonished it took you this long to stop it with that terrible joke of yours, Mi-
It's quite astounding that you managed to keep up that facade for so long, Tao-
Good luck, human whelp. This is something far beyond your ordinary human eyes.
Did you not listen to my introduction? I go by many titles. Sakuya, if you would please?
If you had been paying attention, you would have heard Sakuya call me by my titles. I will have her tell you them once again.
Of course I change in the mornings and evenings. What kind of slobbish woman do you take me for?
Laugh while you can, holy woman. I can assure you that you will not get many more opportunities to do so.
Such is the privilege of nobility, white knight. Chivalry may still be alive, but clearly feudalism is the relic of a bygone age.
On occasion. The roots of my wings are particularly troublesome to clean by myself...
It is only natural for one as noble as I to lead the masses. Sakuya, my hat, if you'd please.
It appears I have lost. I do appreciate a change of pace, for once. Sakuya, if you'd please.
I suppose a game is only fun when it is challenging. Sakuya! My hat.
It is about time that I actually participate in this game of yours. Sakuya, would you please take my hat back to the mansion?
In the grand scheme of things, this loss means little. Sakuya, if you'd please.
This is only my second loss, but I am simply wearing far too much. Sakuya, we must remedy this.
You have managed to best me again, is it? I am sure that I have been putting up quite a challenge! Allow me to show you some mercy.
It appears that you've managed to overcome my first challenge. For a bunch of lowborns, you are putting up an impressive fight!
It was a hard fought battle, but you have finally managed to take another round off of me.
And here I thought I would do naught but stand here for the rest of the game! You certainly took your time to win a round off of me.
Even this far into the game, you commonfolk still cling on to hope...
I am glad to see my advantage has not stolen away your hopes of winning.
The lowborn truly do have the tenacity that allows them to fight to the bitter end...
Oh? Was that your last hurrah? There is still some fight in you all, it seems! Wonderful!
For all your faults, the tenacity of humankind is quite impressive! I too, then, will show off my own pride!
I congratulate you, peasants! I had almost thought you all had given up on winning!
My apologies, Milady, but it appears Lady Flandre has escaped from the basement. I'm afraid Patchouli requires my assistance.
Milady. I am sorry to report, but Patchouli has alerted me that Lady Flandre has broken out of the basement. I must return to the Mansion.
Patchouli has requested I return to the Mansion, Milady. It seems that your sister has plotted an escape from the basement.
It appears I have lost. Well, no matter. Sakuya! Please take my hat away.
Allow this loss to be my gift to you all. Sakuya, if you could, please.
I will raise no complaints about losing a game of chance. Sakuya - if you would do the honour?
Oho? You've all managed to win another round off me? It seems this game will entertain me after all.
I suppose the first win was no fluke. Very well then, you have earned the right to see me remove something else.
A second victory? My, my. You are all putting up quite a fight today! How wonderful.
Hmph. You've bested me once again? Well, I suppose I mustn't let your efforts go unrewarded.
I was under the impression you would never best me again, but it appears I was wrong. Very well then, I will remove something else.
Did you manage to best me once more? It seems that fate was on your side, for this round at least.
Sakuya. I do not need to explain my next move, yes?
Sakuya. It should be obvious which item of clothing needs to be removed next.
Sakuya. Remove the next item.
I do believe now is an appropriate time to stop playing around!
You've proven your worth! Allow me to take you all a little more seriously!
I must commend you all on your efforts, to have put me in such a position that I will have to use this!
My apologies, Milady, but it appears Lady Flandre has escaped from the basement. I'm afraid Patchouli requires my assistance.
Milady. I am sorry to report, but Patchouli has alerted me that Lady Flandre has broken out of the basement. I must return to the Mansion.
Patchouli has requested I return to the Mansion, Milady. It seems that your sister has plotted an escape from the basement.
Do not misunderstand, plebeians. I am in a good mood for now, and as such, I will play along with this game of yours. Sakuya?
I am not so petty as to refuse to play by the rules of this game. I will be removing my hat - Sakuya!
A loss is a loss. Just do not assume that this will continue forever. Sakuya, kindly take my hat away.
I suppose you all needed to overcome the difference in clothing numbers somehow. Allow me to assist you.
Not one, but two wins? I am glad to see you are all doing your very best to take me down! Here, I will reward you all for your efforts.
I am quite fond of a good challenge. Very few fights will see me with my back against the wall... Perhaps I will up the ante for this one.
It appears that I have underestimated you commoners. Maybe you are more than mere insects after all?
Superb. Simply sublime! It may be that you all are not as boring as you first seemed!
Ufufu. Delightful! It seems that this game truly is quite entertaining!
Another loss? Hmph. So be it. Sakuya?
You are all fighting with everything you have, aren't you? Wonderful. Sakuya?
Perhaps I have underestimated you all? You are putting up quite a fight, today.
You've done well to push me this far! Perhaps I will have to think a little more highly of you all!
If I'm in this position, I guess I have no choice but to take you all seriously now!
Perhaps I have been playing around a little too much. Very well, peons! It is time for me to take this seriously!
My apologies, Milady, but it appears Lady Flandre has escaped from the basement. I'm afraid Patchouli requires my assistance.
Milady. I am sorry to report, but Patchouli has alerted me that Lady Flandre has broken out of the basement. I must return to the Mansion.
Patchouli has requested I return to the Mansion, Milady. It seems that your sister has plotted an escape from the basement.
Regardless of whether or not Milady's origins are true or not, my master is still Remilia.
You say that, accursed Saint, but your own chest is hardly any more more developed than my own.
Here, grey one, allow me to show you how it is done...
A respectable demeanour and refined taste. Perhaps it would be prudent for me to remember your name.
I have lived for over 600 years now, blondie. If I am a child to you, you must be a relic from a bygone age, no?
At the age of 600, I still get mistaken for a child. You are but a fraction of that, yet I'm sure you still get mistaken for a grandmother.
I would hope that you could mask that envy of yours just a little bit. It's quite unbefitting of a lady to gripe so loudly.
Does it wound you, that one who appears to be a child is far superior in beauty and grace?
There's no need to fear, young descendent of Tepes. Sakuya has taken good care of my hat.
I am known as the 'Perfect and Elegant Maid', Miss Fey. It is my duty to complete tasks issued to me in such a manner.
It is my obligation to do as Milady commands, Miss Fey. To not do so to the best of my ability would stain my reputation as the 'Perfect and Elegant Maid'.
How brazen of you to be flattering me so blatantly, Taoist. Perhaps I will need to rethink my opinion of you.
Hmph. It figures that a child such as yourself wouldn't be able to comprehend an adult's tricks.
Sama? Ah, right, that is how you oriental folk pay your respects. I generally prefer 'Miss Scarlet', but that will suffice.
Oho. You're sharper than you look, to see through Sakuya's powers so easily.
You fail to recognise my own powers, yet understand my maid's in a heartbeat? What a strange little human you are.
...Why I am winged? Do you also ask fish why they have gills, horses why they have tails, and holy women why they lack brains?
I will remove both my socks and my shoes for you all, and you offer such a paltry reply as that, chaneller? You wound me!
It's far too late for your flattery, girl. I know better than to trust the prattle of a child.
An aristocratic tailor? I suppose nobility does give one plenty of free time to pursue their own interests.
Normally I would leave tailoring to my servants, but I do suppose there is some charm in making clothing for yourself to wear.
Oh, believe me, goddess. There will be much more interesting things to come.
If you are referring to the "extravagance" and "splendor" of a mere human, then there truly is nothing for me to fear.
...Aren't you supposed to be able to read my desires, Saint? Surely, you know of my immense desire to carve you up at this point, no?
...Too bad you can only listen to ten of my desires at once, Miko. I have imagined many more ways of ending your little life than that.
...You're reincarnated, right, Miko? That means it's fine for me to kill you, since you'll just come back again, no?
...Are you an immortal, Miko? Killing you just once won't be enough to satisfy me at this point.
If I am "comically undersized", what does that make you, child? I wouldn't even call you a human - at that size, you'd be half a human at best.
'World of Crimson', 'Vampire of Heavy Fog', 'The Eternally Young Scarlet Moon', 'Nocturnal Devil of Scarlet'...
A physical confrontation with other women in Gensokyo is hardly an uncommon sight, even for one such as I--
I'm afraid I must humbly decline, Madam Miko. I serve Lady Remilia first and foremost.
If those filthy human hands of yours draw even a millimetre closer to my stomach, I will separate them from the rest of your body.
Jealous? Why, if you'd like to pledge your subservience to me, Zizou Olympia, you are more than welcome to.
I can assure you, Miko, that I am not interested in developing such useless sacks of fat.
A playdate? Now, of all times?
Do you think that I would throw knives at myself like this?
The knives are Sakuya's, not my own.
So you wish to accompany me, is that right, Zizou? Ufufu...
I can handle these fools by myself, anyway! Have at you!
So be it, Sakuya! These are but men, naught more than a miserable little pile of secrets!
I have returned your hat to your room at the Mansion, Milady.
Your hat has been returned to the hat rack in your room, Milady.
It has been done, Milady. Lady Yukari has made it quite easy to return to the Mansion.
I am feeling generous this round. I will remove both my socks and my shoes.
Sakuya will take off my shoes and my socks for this round. I will allow this small mercy to my foes.
Rejoice, for my gift to all of you will be to remove two layers for this round. Sakuya. My socks and my shoes - you may take them away.
Kudos to you, commonfolk. To make me, Remilia Scarlet, have to remove her dress, is no small feat!
Few may cast their eyes on the great Remilia Scarlet laying herself bare. To have earned this right, you must all be quivering in joy!
I offer you all a round of applause, for very few are allowed to cast their eyes on the unclothed beauty of Remilia Scarlet. Bravo, peasants, bravo.
Sakuya... Fawn over me as much as you'd like, but do not miss your cues. Remove my bra.
Sakuya. Stop playing around back there and remove my bra.
I expect my head maid to have more awareness than that. Are you going to remove my bra any time soon, Sakuya?
My bra is still on, Sakuya. You were supposed to remedy that.
So be it, Sakuya! I do not require your assistance to take care of these mere mortals!
That damned mischievous sister of mine! Very well, Sakuya, go if needs must!
Flan, why must you have chosen now of all times to fool around!? Do whatever you must, Sakuya! I will not be much longer!
...well, I suppose she is the current successor and all...
Wonderfully said, Sakuya! You see, Hermit, no maid would show this much devotion to a lesser vampire.
You truly are an idiot. Mosquito bites don't even begin to resemble a vampire's bite.
Giving up already? Well, I was foolish to believe that a human would pose any sort of challenge to me at all.
I think "a little" is quite the understatement there, white knight.
If anyone here needs to be babied, it's you, white knight.
While less of a visual spectacle, I do believe it's quite impressive, nonetheless.
Gensokyo? You know about Gensokyo? Well then, it seems I really will have to remember your name, Elizabeth.
Oh? I can sense it from your eyes, tall boy - you saw that, didn't you? Ufufu, how very interesting!
Did you miss that, grandma? I suppose older ladies do tend to have their eyesight worsen when they reach such an advanced age.
What's wrong, blondie, becoming senile already? Are your eyes okay, or is it your brain that can't keep up?
Do I really need to spell it out to you, old lady? Yes, I have removed my hat. Has your age really caused your brain to rot that quickly?
My, my. Yes, I did remove my hat. I am glad you've noticed - it seems that you've managed to keep your mind sharp, even at that age.
I certainly am not a magician, especially not when compared with our librarian, Patchouli. I am merely Milady's handmaiden.
Sakuya is a woman of many talents. Her title of "Perfect and Elegant Maid" isn't just for show, after all.
It was no small feat to arrive here to begin with, and without the help of Miss Yukari, it would be even more difficult to return. Prison is no understatement.
Believe me, it was no small feat to arrive here to begin with. The human world may as well be a prison to a resident of Gensokyo.
While I have no problems accommodating my little sister's friends, I do have problems with your feeble attempt at Flandre's name.
That is a noble's secret, tsukumogami. Try using that tiny little head of yours and figure it out yourself.
Did I mention Gensokyo..? No matter. It is a different world, both quite near and quite far away from this one. Any more would bore me, so let us return to the game.
When did I say Gensokyo..? It is a world both separated and attached to this one. Any further explanation will have to wait, girl - there is a game to be played.
You claim to be a slayer of monsters, and yet you do not recognise one right before your very eyes. Just how have you managed to survive up to this point?
For the sake of this fine establishment, I will pretend I didn't hear you relate me to a petty succubus, Taoist. That, and your thinly-veiled lust towards my gatekeeper.
Milady needs not concern herself with things like that, Miss Asagiri. It's completely my duty to do menial tasks like clothing her.
I only demand that which I deserve, little one.
I would think that I am actually quite reasonable. For example, I have not demanded you present me your neck on a silver platter. Yet.
My apologies, Madam Elizabeth, but I am currently serving Milady Remilia. I cannot abandon my duties to her.
Hmph, changing your tone so quickly? How boring.
Oh, this drink? Well... it's probably not what you think it is, young Mavis. I know better than to let myself go in a situation like this.
You may have been joking, Miko, but I definitely wasn't.
You'll forgive me if it's hard to believe you, Hermit. I hope you'll continue to forgive me after I've torn you to shreds.
But of course, I much prefer the simplicity of 'The Scarlet Devil'. Anyhow, Sakuya, I'm quite parched. Fetch me a drink, will you?
I go by many titles, but 'The Scarlet Devil' is the one I prefer. This game is making me quite thirsty - Sakuya, would you bring me a drink?
So that's where you were going with that line of questioning... Sakuya isn't my only maid, so of course there are others.
My apologies, Priestess L'Arachel, but I do not think I will be changing employer any time soon.
I will absolutely al-- NOT allow that. No good. Not at all. Never.
I do not require a mere human to tell me what I can and cannot do.
Many thanks for the advice, little one. I'll be sure to ignore it just like all the other things humans tend to rant about.
I have many maids besides Sakuya, if you are so inclined... although I can tell that you wish for a certain someone else to tend to you...
The moment this game finishes, Miko, we are going to play one of my games instead...
Again with the damn succubi jokes... Mark my words, Saint, you are not long for this world...
Me? The great Remilia Scarlet? Drunk? Of course not.
I may appear to be short in stature, but I am over 600 years old. I can handle my drinks just fine.
Prove it to me with your actions, spirit. Or are you a dog whose bark is louder than her bite?
Need I point out the irony of a spirit telling me about the tenacity of humans?
...Dealer. This game needs to finish. NOW.
...Neither victory nor defeat matter now. This game needs to end. Quickly.
Have we not had this conversation before, little girl, or is your tiny human brain incapable of retaining even the simplest of information? Miss Remilia.
Are you some kind of imbecile, or are you forgetting my name on purpose in an attempt to rile me up? My name is Remilia.
I am confident that Sakuya will return to bring me back to my mansion... but you are free to come along, if you are so inclined.
It is quite comforting to know that we will be able to return to Gensokyo once we are done. Well then? Shall we start the next round?
I am pleased that that old hag has made herself useful, for once. As long as we can return home at the end of the day, I will have no complaints about her.
You were able to return, is it? That is good news indeed. While I have no issues with remaining in the human world, I would grow to miss the Mansion.
Savour this moment, for this is as far as I will be going this game.
This is, after all, the most bare skin I will be exposing this game.
A master knows when to reward her pets. Do not allow my generosity to go to waste.
Although... Sakuya. I do believe now is an appropriate time for refreshments.
Sakuya! I am quite peckish, and I'd hate to... make a mess in front of all these people. Fetch me a drink.
However, I am beginning to become quite parched - Sakuya, go bring me something to drink.
Well then? Don't just stand there! Start the next round!
Do you expect me to have a grand speech prepared for each and every action of this game? Carry on, Dealer.
Did you want me to say more? Have you become that enamoured with me?
If you manage to surpass this, I suppose I have no choice but to acknowledge you all.
Few have managed to rise up against their fates. Will you all join their ranks, or will you succumb to destiny?
I have witnessed few people who could break the chains of destiny. I am not expecting to encounter more today, but I am open to being pleasantly surprised.
Ahem. You may have taken my final layer, but I won't lose this last hand so easily.
If Flan is out causing chaos, then it is unlikely Sakuya will return quickly. Regardless, let us continue.
Sakuya and Patchouli will be more than enough to take care of that cheeky little sister of mine.
You. ~Player~, or whatever your name is. Somehow, you have managed to capture my attention.
Ufufu, it is only natural that I would win. Now then, how will you entertain me, ~player~?
Heeh. Did you think you had a chance against me? How cute.
~player~, I certainly hope you weren't planning to escape your fate.
Now, how will you entertain this Lady of the Night, ~player~?
It is in your interest to keep me entertained, ~player~, lest I succumb to some... other temptations.
Go on. Dance for me, ~player~.
Be glad that I am kind enough to spare the time to watch you, ~player~.
Entertain me, ~player~, and perhaps I will bestow upon you my favour.
What will you do now, ~player~? Have you found a way to amuse me yet?
Do you know how lucky you are to have caught my attention, ~player~? Plenty would die for it, and others have.
You should, as you commonfolk say, 'count your blessings', ~player~. To have earned my gaze, how thrilling this must be for you!

state.text: Curse your damnable fate, ~player~, for this loss is not to be blamed on you.

case.state: There is no shame in losing at this point, ~player~.
You have fought well, ~player~, but there is little you can do to prevent your destiny.
Don't worry about losing, ~player~. It was an inevitability.
You struggle against the tides of fate, ~player~.
~player~. It'll take more than perseverance to change your fate.
Few can prevent fate, ~player~, and I highly doubt you are one of them.
Do not be ashamed about losing against insurmountable odds, ~player~.
You have tried, and failed, to escape your destiny, ~player~.
It is respectable to try, ~player~, even knowing you shall fail.
I appreciate your effort, ~player~, but you will need more than effort to overcome me.
While I'm quite used to such open hostility towards vampires, I didn't expect to see that here today in the human world.
Don't think I didn't notice your little trick either, boy.

state.text: Will you be demonstrating your powers for us once more?
Oh, wonderful. I wonder what this one-man comedy act is going to do for us this time.
I quite enjoy when humans decide to debase themselves to gain my favour. It is simply the natural order of things, no?
Bah, this boorish lout keeps going on about 'man'. Man this, man that!

case.state: Wings of white, and an aura enough to blind one's eyes...
Did you know, my dear angel boy, that the blood of a full fledged god is toxic to vampires?
Don't get conceited. You may have bested me, but do not forget that this was all merely a game.
If I had used the full extent of my power from the beginning, you would all be grovelling at my feet right now.
Yes, yes, you've beaten me. Gloat while you still can.
It takes quite a lot of concentration to do this while flying...
Perhaps I should have found a chair to do this on...
I never would have imagined that this is what that old hag Yukari had in store for me...
(...All these actions would seem harmless at first glance, but I know there's more to them than they're letting on..!)
(...They all act calm and composed, but I know what they're all really thinking..!)
I must say - I'm beginning to warm up to this game of yours.
And so, I've won the round. Would you expect anything less from one such as I?

You're five hundred years too early to best a vampire, fool.

I'm finding it hard to focus on things right n- hic.
A-ah, the drink's really kicking in now...
I-I'm not usually this bad when it comes to drinking-!
I may need to abandon my dignity, but I cannot throw away my pride.
Well, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't interested in the game's outcome at this point.
At least I can relax somewhat. It's quite exhausting to manipulate fate for so long.
Well? Go on then. I may have been beaten, but I still expect to be entertained.
I may no longer be able to play the game, but that just means you all have my full attention.
So? What will you do to keep me interested?
I hope to see something exciting, lest I fall asleep right here.
Do try to keep me amused, won't you?
If nothing interesting happens, I may just nod off.

Mavis... Mavis... Mavis..? Daughter of Dracula, you say?
I refuse. A True Ancestor, such as myself, bowing down to another? How absurd.
Anyway, young Mavis, what I was trying to say before I was so rudely interrupted by that uncouth and lowly Hermit was that I-
Have I even made claim to the vampire throne before? At this point, all this buffoon is doing is spewing lies and deceit.
Now that that idiotic Miko has finally stopped talking, I can finally explain my relation to the young Dracula before us.
Oh? It appears that the speedy one is coming back around.
I sure do hope that you understand just what that book is, young witch.
That large weapon is a firearm, is it not, Saku-
Sakuya. That trick with the bouncing projectiles - isn't that quite similar to your technique with those knives?
Again with the gun trick? Sigh.

state.text: Can't that little gun of yours fire in more than one direction? No?
Once more, then? There's little else you could do with your gun at this point.
Finally. Is it time for little miss plant princess to be give us a show?
Now then, little plant princess, we can finally get back to the main event.
It seems we will be finally ridding you of that little garden you have built up, plant princess.
Say goodbye to your sad little excuse for 'clothing', plant princess.

case.state: Your bad premonition is surprisingly accurate, woman.
Oh? What's this? An eastern martial artist?
I wonder... Sakuya? Who do you believe would win in an encounter between Meiling and this eastern pugilist?
Oh, of course! I simply must bring Meiling along with me next time.
My, my. What a fluffy looking human!
Is that a sword? No, it's not just a sword, but a rapier!
Nothing quite speaks of one's nobility like a fine blade made of cold steel, much unlike those boorish firearms humans so love.
After investigating some more, Lady Remilia, I have found out that she is a "Virtual Youtuber".
Now then- Sakuya! What is this "virtuous ewe tuber" you speak of?
...You, floating woman, are you not a vampire?
It's quite odd to see someone clothed from head to toe like that. Sakuya, is that some sort of human fashion?
Sakuya, isn't one of your spellcards named "Marinette" as well?
Oho, to think I would encounter another of noble blood!
You said your name was Mavis? Mavis Dracula? Daughter of the Count Dracula?
Well, young Mavis, have you not heard the name 'Remilia Scarlet' from your father before?
Then, what of the name, "Elizabeth Bathory"? It is likely not a name you would have heard of either.
Anyhow, the bloodline of House Dracula is spread a lot further than you could imagine, young Mavis.
(Well then, do you think she bought it, Sakuya?)
Sakuya. Tell me, what is that strange object that woman has over her eyes?
Blue-haired woman. Tell me, what was that 'eyepiece' that you removed earlier?
From what I've picked up, you aren't from this world, are you, space woman?
Tell me, Meia, you would need a ship to travel to and from this planet, no?

state.text: Wait, Miko? Are you not the one who calls herself the Christian Pope?
You intend to take off so little? I suppose I shouldn't expect any integrity from a mere human, after all.
Miko, were you not the one responsible for that 'divine spirit incident' a while ago?
It is a little too early to be panicking, Pope. Do you not see the necklace still wrapped around your neck?
Do not get so worked up about a mere card game, Pope.

case.state: Oh? A maid? Have you come here with your master? Or are you under the employment of this establishment?
It has been just a short while, but I see no issues with the maid's performance thus far.
At this point, Nugi-chan, I don't think there are any problems with your mannerisms at all.
It's a shame we can't test your skills as a maid, Nugi. While your... entertainment skills are fine, there are other areas a maid should specialize in.
Ufufu. Sakuya - this girl, what did she say her name was?
Those are... firearms, are they not?
I can see the flow of one's fate, but I cannot see their past.
An oni princess? How bizarre. I did not know the oni had a noble class at all.
Anyway, were you saying something to me before, oni princess?
Human, I'm interested. Just what in the world are you wearing?
A knight, then... do you pledge allegiance to a feudal lord? Or perhaps you are a member of a monastic order?
What in the world does a knight even do, in an age such as this?
This blonde girl certainly is quite bizarre, to be so excited about losing a hand.
Now that we've gotten your misunderstanding over with, tell me, Shimikaze: You aren't human, are you?
I should have known you were a youkai, girl. There's an acrid smell to your blood that reminds me of the alcohol those oni drink.
I suppose we'll be seeing another explosion any time now.
I do have to ask, though - are you going to explode every time you take something off?
Oh, yes, Shimikaze. I have to ask you - were you designed after a rabbit?
I'm not exactly fond of rabbits. I may have had a certain... bad experience with them in the past. Those damn Lunarians.

state.text: Ah-! Is it time for you to remove your last piece of clothing, tsukumogami?

case.state: It's quite interesting to see that humans have unlocked some sort of latent powers within them.
You said humans have managed to find some powers... called "quirks", no? How very amusing!
Would you look at that! It appears the grey goddess has lost!
I wasn't quite listening - what did you say you were a goddess of, purple one? Butterflies?
Tell me, half-color. What is it that a goddess of balance even does?
Well then, Zizou. You know, Gensokyo has a way of self-regulating magic and its use - the 'spellcard system'.
I sense that you also have a poor opinion of humanity.
Most fools I encounter who claim to be of the divine are truly detestable beings. However, I must say, Zizou...
That trick with the bouncing projectiles... I think Sakuya is capable of doing something similar with her knives.
Your bad premonition is surprisingly accurate, woman.
It's quite odd to see someone clothed from head to toe like that. What is that, some sort of human fashion?
I believe Sakuya had a spellcard named "Marinette" that she used to use as a trump card...
(That should have been enough to convince her... probably.)
Let us put aside this tomfoolery, Yukari. Return us to Gensokyo at once.

state.text: It doesn't matter if the gears of time are turning or not. These eyes of mine have read the script of fate.
... What.
You may have caught my attention the first time around, but your poor showing earlier has left me quite disappointed.

case.state: Yes, there's no doubt about it. You, winged boy, you are an angel, are you not?
Yet, they say that the blood of an angel is quite different. Rumors say that it has quite a... heavenly taste to it.
I would suggest that you contain that temper of yours around Milady, ~name~. I cannot guarantee your safety otherwise.
I have never understood the point of flashy armour such as yours, ~name~. Do you wish to throw away the element of surprise?
Would you say this person's athletic abilities rival that of yours, Sakuya?
While it is true that confidence goes a long way...
They think that such a paltry disguise will be able to hide their true identity...
Milady, would you like to wear something similar to ~name~'s ~clothing~? I could put something together for you if you wish.
It has been so long since I have last brought out my dear Gungnir. This peasant looks like they would struggle quite nicely, kuhuhu...
Magic? Well, I do suppose that it isn't that uncommon to see humans with magical powers. After all, we do have one such being under my employ.
By the way, how tall are you, Sakuya? I don't believe I've ever asked.
Oho, it seems that this peon has come ready for a fight. Should I bring out Gungnir then?
Is that all you will be taking off for this round? Some tiny trinket?
How do you still have your ~clothing~ at this point in the game?
You would dare take off so little at this point in the game?
Will that be all you remove? Just your ~clothing~?
Just a trinket? Is that all?
Such a minor, insignificant bauble?
Is that all you will be taking off?
Surely, that does not constitute one whole layer of clothing?
Are you not going to take this opportunity to show off your determination? No?
Oh? Just your ~clothing~?
Why delay the inevitable? Just take off everything now and save yourself the effort.
Why don't you save everybody some time and take it all off now?
Must we go through this whole charade? You all are assured to lose anyway.
You are impressing nobody with that song and dance of yours. Hurry it up, will you?
I would hope that this is all just a prelude to something far more interesting.
That's it..? How utterly boring.
Is that all for this round? I suppose I shouldn't have expected better from a lesser being.
And that old hag told me I would be entertained? What rubbish.
Hwaah. Some would tell me it's rude to yawn aloud, but a pathetic display such as that does not deserve consideration.
Is this really supposed to be as fun as that old hag described?
Is that all? Do you think you can just waste my time like this?
I had heard commoners were renowned for their recklessness and audacity, yet you would remove such small items of clothing?
You would let my attention go to waste by taking off so little? The audacity!
Why am I not surprised that the commonfolk have failed to live up to expectations once again?
I asked to be entertained, not to be put to sleep!
My, my? Still removing baubles, are we?
You've managed to hold out quite well if you still have accessories to remove.
You seem to still have quite a lot on.
If you're still taking off irrelevant things, then you must be quite proficient at this game, no?
It seems someone here has some semblance of skill.
Did you prepare this much clothing in advance?
(He's taking off... just his ~clothing~?)
(I don't think there will be much coming off this round, but...)
You still have accessories to take off this late into the game?
There are still trinkets to be removed?
Was it that you brought a lot of accessories with you? Or are you just a master at this game?
Just how many baubles are you wearing?
Absurd. You're still wearing how much?
You still have accessories to spare at this point?
Ah, then, there's no doubt. You were quite intimately acquainted with a vampire in the past, weren't you, tall one?
I've seen some interesting things in that fate of yours, quite interesting things indeed.
Wha- pu, ku, nf... What an incredible display of... skill... kukuku...

state.text: The idea, though, of a mere jester becoming serious? How absurd!

case.state: How amusing! It is not often I get the opportunity to play with one of the lesser divine species.
It's a very interesting rumour, wouldn't you say? It makes me wonder if there is any merit to it at all!
I've seen some interesting things in that fate of yours, quite interesting things indeed.

state.text: Wha- pu, ku, nf... What an incredible display of... skill...

case.state: I will be keeping an eye on you, human. Do try not to disappoint me.
(Here I am masturbating in front of them all, and he has removed nothing of value. How frustrating.)
Go on, gloat all you want, peasant.
How boring. Do you not crave any excitement in that boring little life of yours?
B-believe me when I say I am incredibly frustrated by now...
Remove as many baubles as you need, commoner.
You could be wearing all the trinkets in the world. If I am here, it is your destiny to lose.
It is much like the lowborn to adorn themselves with such an excess of trinkets.
I may have lived for 500 years already, but I do not wish to wait 500 more just to finish this game.
Honestly. I did not know the serfs could even afford such minor trinkets!
I see no need to play any further if this is all you have to offer.
If that's all you have for me, I may as well not have even come tonight.
If your plan is to bore me to death, I can assure you, you are succeeding.
Once again, a peon fails to do anything meaningful.
Are the commonfolk so incapable of showing initiative nowadays?
Dealer, do not test Milady's patience. Begin the next round.
Well then? Shall we play the next round?
Do not waste Milady's time, Dealer. Begin the next round at once.
Must I say more? Dealer. I do believe it is time to begin the next round.
Do you expect me to have more to say? I think you are mistaken.
I do not wish to waste my time commenting on such meaningless things. Begin the next round.
Milady has nothing more to say. Let us begin the next round, Dealer.
I have no desire to waste any more time. Start the next round. Now.
Dealer. Perhaps we should start the next round, lest Milady's mood worsen.
Dealer, Milady grows impatient. I believe you should deal the next hand already.
Be careful not to squander away that lead - not that you'll have a choice, anyway.
All you are doing is delaying the inevitable. It's not something worth praising.
Let us see how long the rest of your clothes will last.
Oh, don't worry. The rest will be coming off shortly.
We will remove the rest. All in due time, of course.
You could be wearing as many baubles as you'd like, but it won't be changing the end result.
(It must be a trick to catch me off guard so he can ravish me while I'm distracted!)
(Those subtle movements of his arms... is this hypnosis!?)
(T-this is all a prelude to something bigger! I can feel it! I won't be tricked!)
(I won't be fooled by this ruse! I'm watching you!)
I wasn't paying much attention to you all, so I had no idea...
Even if my fate manipulation worked, perhaps I still would have lost...
Perhaps I was a little too hasty when it came to removing items...
A-Ahem. You seem to be quite good at this game, lowborn.
Not only did I lose, it seems that I lost quite handily.
Guh, I must say, I am feeling quite frustrated right now.
Silence, you accursed Hermit! I am trying to recall just where I have heard the name Mavis fro--
Is grovelling and apologising all you are good for, Hermit? As expected of a human.
Evidently, you did not, in fact, have any clue just what that book contained.
Sniff. Your blood is that of a regular human, too. Is that skill what you would call a 'fighter's instinct'?
My gatekeeper, Meiling, likely hails from the same lands as you do, human. She claims to be an expert in... tai chi chuan?
...I think that Meiling would win quite handily, Milady.
I know I mock you mortals by calling you "livestock", but to think you would go so far as to dress up as a sheep to amuse me!
To think that some humans would still be using blades of steel to this day!
I, myself, am quite partial to spears. I would love to show off my sweet little Gungnir here, but...
Eh, wait, no... that stench...
She's a 'superhero', Milady. She wears such clothing to hide her identity.
I'm afraid that's not quite right. It is called "Marionette", Lady Remilia.
Pray tell, sister of the night - whose blood flows through your veins? That of the Karsteins? Or are you of the old House Ruthven?
(To think I'd encounter a descendent of Tepes in this place... The whims of fate are not to be trifled with, it seems...)
An eyepiece, Lady Scarlet. However, I can't say I know any more than that. Should I go and ask the kappa?

state.text: Well, at least your consort has some semblance of pride.
As I thought. I had preferred not to get involved during that whole saga.
...Headphones?

case.state: Oho. I see. Well, I'll be observing your performance with interest, maid.
Ah, how exciting! Finally, a human with fire in her eyes! But, should I fan those flames, or should I snuff them out?
Her name is Rebecca, Lady Remilia, but she prefers to be called "Revy".
Honestly, I have never seen a human so eager to pick fights in such a reckless manner.
I must say, I am unfamiliar with their design. Where does one light the fuse?
You would never be able to guess, what with their reckless carousing and their tendency to break out into drunken fistfights.
You're a human, is it? Hmm, is that so... Human, oni, it all matters very little to me.
A knight's outfit? Preposterous. The age of chivalry is long gone.
Nothing about you is even remotely holy, so I suppose the latter is completely out of the question.
Both a medic and a peacekeeper? Hmph, just like those pesky Hospitaller.
Milady, I believe Miss Shimakaze has misunderstood the rules of the game
Yes, yes, Shimakaze - but a warship? Do you mean to say you are some kind of youkai? A tsukumogami?
You never cease to amaze me, tsukumogami.
And these quirks are not given, are they, but rather they're inherent?
Are you humans born with these powers? Or are they 'unlocked' through some strange means?
What sort of magic do you have in store for us now?
You claim to be goddess of balance? With a form like that?
I can't imagine that being the case. Is it... a disguise of sorts?
Or perhaps it was "Marionette"?
I would do well to remember your name. Was it... Rebecca? No, it was Revy, was it not?
It's pretty clear you have no idea how to play this game, girl...
Are you making fun of me, Yukari?
I would suggest that you contain that temper of yours around Milady, ~name~. I cannot guarantee your safety otherwise.
I have never understood the point of flashy armour such as yours, ~name~. Do you wish to throw away the element of surprise?
Would you say this person's athletic abilities rival that of yours, Sakuya?
While it is true that confidence goes a long way...
They think that such a paltry disguise will be able to hide their true identity...
Milady, would you like to wear something similar to ~name~'s ~clothing~? I could put something together for you if you wish.
It has been so long since I have last brought out my dear Gungnir. This peasant looks like they would struggle quite nicely, kuhuhu...
Magic? Well, I do suppose that it isn't that uncommon to see humans with magical powers. After all, we do have one such being under my employ.
What say you, Sakuya? How would this one fare as a servant of the Scarlet Devil Mansion?
Eugh. A succubus. You dirty creatures, do you have no shame?
By the way, how tall are you, Sakuya? I don't believe I've ever asked.
Oho, it seems that this peon has come ready for a fight. Should I bring out Gungnir then?
Is that all you will be taking off for this round? Some tiny trinket?
How do you still have your ~clothing~ at this point in the game?
You would dare take off so little at this point in the game?
Will that be all you remove? Just your ~clothing~?
Milady, have you ever thought about growing your hair out? I think it would suit you.
Just a trinket? Is that all?
Such a minor, insignificant bauble?
Is that all you will be taking off?
Surely, that does not constitute one whole layer of clothing?
Are you not going to take this opportunity to show off your determination? No?
Oh? Just your ~clothing~?
Why delay the inevitable? Just take off everything now and save yourself the effort.
Why don't you save everybody some time and take it all off now?
Must we go through this whole charade? You all are assured to lose anyway.
You are impressing nobody with that song and dance of yours. Hurry it up, will you?
I would hope that this is all just a prelude to something far more interesting.
That's it..? How utterly boring.
Is that all for this round? I suppose I shouldn't have expected better from a lesser being.
And that old hag told me I would be entertained? What rubbish.
Hwaah. Some would tell me it's rude to yawn aloud, but a pathetic display such as that does not deserve consideration.
Is this really supposed to be as fun as that old hag described?
Is that all? Do you think you can just waste my time like this?
I had heard commoners were renowned for their recklessness and audacity, yet you would remove such small items of clothing?
You would let my attention go to waste by taking off so little? The audacity!
Why am I not surprised that the commonfolk have failed to live up to expectations once again?
I asked to be entertained, not to be put to sleep!
My, my? Still removing baubles, are we?
You've managed to hold out quite well if you still have accessories to remove.
You seem to still have quite a lot on.
If you're still taking off irrelevant things, then you must be quite proficient at this game, no?
It seems someone here has some semblance of skill.
Did you prepare this much clothing in advance?
(She's taking off... just her ~clothing~?)
(I don't think there will be much coming off this round, but...)
You still have accessories to take off this late into the game?
There are still trinkets to be removed?
Was it that you brought a lot of accessories with you? Or are you just a master at this game?
Just how many baubles are you wearing?
Absurd. You're still wearing how much?
You still have accessories to spare at this point?
You dare call into question the validity of my lineage!? You tempt fate, you damned Saint!
It's quite adorable how you believe that humans are capable of anything resembling "nobility".
Do you really think that human aristocracy could even hold a candle to that of vampires? Don't make me laugh, Hermit.
I'd recommend against summoning eldritch horrors into the world. I am already here, after all.
Go on, dealer. Begin with the next round already.
Tch, what was with that ear-piercing scream, tsukumogami!?
Meiling often speaks about how she has honed her mind to be able to sense bloodlust, even while asleep. Pugilists are quite interesting, it seems.
That phrase means nothing to me, but I would assume you would understand what it means, martial artist.
Funny you should say that. I was of the same opinion.
I wonder, then. Will your blood taste as sweet as your demeanour?
Perhaps you may have some class after all, blonde human. You may even be worth paying attention to, at this rate.
...I have taken a liking to this little establishment, after all. Rending this place asunder would be quite improper of me.
You disgusting, impure half-blood! The audacity, to appear in front of a noble such as I! Do you wish for me to end your pitiful existence that badly?
Hide? A hero who feels the need to hide? How petty these human heroes are!
Oh, like the puppet? It appears I was mistaken.
Ah, the next-in-line of House Dr-- House Dracula!?
Hmm, is that so? Interesting, very interesting...
No, that won't be necessary. It is much simpler to just ask this human about it whenever it seems prudent.

state.text: To think one with such a title as 'Saint' would be so petty.
Matters of religion mean little to me - I'm not interested in stealing souls, nor enslaving man.
O-of course I know what headphones are! They're... phones for your head. Of course.

case.state: As the head maid of the Scarlet Devil Mansion, I too am interested in the works of a maid from the human world.
Yes, she's a feisty one for sure. I will certainly have my fun with you, dear girl.
Oho? So your title is Revy? Very well, I will remember this.
There is a fine line between foolishness and bravery. I wonder to which side of the line you lie, Revy?
S-such insolent behaviour! I have grown fond of you, girl, but I won't let such mockeries slide.
If only those idiots didn't turn their party venues into giant craters most of the time, especially whenever they decide to barge in on my own little gatherings...
Give me a reason to remember that, fire princess, otherwise I will call you however I please.
Still, a modern day knight, you say? I suppose it makes sense - there'd be knights running rampant in Gensokyo if it were not the case.
Yes, it was the rampant alcoholism that gave it away.
And like the Hospitaller, it is only a matter of time until your White Knights fall into antiquity once more...
and has just set herself on fire, without so much as a scorch mark.
and has just set herself on fire, without so much as a scorch mark.
So it's possession, as opposed to gaining sentience? My, eastern folklore is quite interesting.
How fascinating! Perhaps you will all offer me a more interesting challenge than the humans of old.
My my, is that so? I may need to organise a bit of... sport... while I am here in the human world.
There's nothing impressive about removing clothing with the click of your fingers, grey goddess.
I am entirely unsurprised that a goddess is claiming to be the embodiment of perfection.
Oh, you're removing clothing with the snap of your fingers? How original.
Meiling often speaks about how she has honed her mind to be able to sense bloodlust, even while asleep. Pugilists are quite interesting, it seems.
Well, I think "Marionette" would make much more sense, actually. Did I get your hopes up, little ladybug?
...I'm sure Sakuya would have been interested in you too, if she were still here.
Oho? Your title was indeed Revy, then? Very well, I shall remember that.
and you just set yourself on fire, without so much as a scorch mark.
I tire of your games, gap youkai. Don't say such slanderous things about my head maid.
I will be keeping an eye on you, human. Do try not to disappoint me.
Your filthy race completely lacks the pride required to be called Creatures of the Night, peh.
(Here I am masturbating in front of them all, and she has removed nothing of value. How frustrating.)
Go on, gloat all you want, peasant.
How boring. Do you not crave any excitement in that boring little life of yours?
B-believe me when I say I am incredibly frustrated by now...
Remove as many baubles as you need, commoner.
You could be wearing all the trinkets in the world. If I am here, it is your destiny to lose.
It is much like the lowborn to adorn themselves with such an excess of trinkets.
I may have lived for 500 years already, but I do not wish to wait 500 more just to finish this game.
Honestly. I did not know the serfs could even afford such minor trinkets!
I see no need to play any further if this is all you have to offer.
If that's all you have for me, I may as well not have even come tonight.
If your plan is to bore me to death, I can assure you, you are succeeding.
Once again, a peon fails to do anything meaningful.
Are the commonfolk so incapable of showing initiative nowadays?
Dealer, do not test Milady's patience. Begin the next round.
Well then? Shall we play the next round?
Do not waste Milady's time, Dealer. Begin the next round at once.
Must I say more? Dealer. I do believe it is time to begin the next round.
Do you expect me to have more to say? I think you are mistaken.
I do not wish to waste my time commenting on such meaningless things. Begin the next round.
Milady has nothing more to say. Let us begin the next round, Dealer.
I have no desire to waste any more time. Start the next round. Now.
Dealer. Perhaps we should start the next round, lest Milady's mood worsen.
Dealer, Milady grows impatient. I believe you should deal the next hand already.
Be careful not to squander away that lead - not that you'll have a choice, anyway.
All you are doing is delaying the inevitable. It's not something worth praising.
Let us see how long the rest of your clothes will last.
Oh, don't worry. The rest will be coming off shortly.
We will remove the rest. All in due time, of course.
You could be wearing as many baubles as you'd like, but it won't be changing the end result.
(It must be a trick to catch me off guard so she can ravish me while I'm distracted!)
(Those subtle movements of her arms... is this hypnosis!?)
(T-this is all a prelude to something bigger! I can feel it! I won't be tricked!)
(I won't be fooled by this ruse! I'm watching you!)
I wasn't paying much attention to you all, so I had no idea...
Even if my fate manipulation worked, perhaps I still would have lost...
Perhaps I was a little too hasty when it came to removing items...
A-Ahem. You seem to be quite good at this game, lowborn.
Not only did I lose, it seems that I lost quite handily.
Guh, I must say, I am feeling quite frustrated right now.
What's wrong, time boy? You seem to be quite tired. Having trouble with those powers of yours?
Some have called me a monster, and others have said that I don't belong to this world.
I had once heard a foolish man claim that I stole the souls of men, and made them my slaves.
Look at you, flaunting your lead like that.
Yes, yes, I know, you have plenty of clothing items left to spare.
Are you just going to remove your ~clothing~? Is that all?
Oh, great, what pointless item will you be removing this time? Your ~clothing~?
Are you surprised that a proud and noble vampire such as myself would lower herself to the same position as you commonfolk?
It's not often that a vampire would lower herself to the same position as a human, but...
Ah, Sakuya, these poor, bewildered plebeians know nothing of Gensokyo! Perhaps you should enlighten them?
That damn Yukari, always doing as she pleases! Who does she think she is, appearing in my mansion like that and whisking us away?
As disturbing as it is that many of you have never heard of me, I suppose it's only natural, what with Gensokyo being a realm of fantasy.
It has been quite a while since we last came to the human world. Sakuya, when was it that we last left Gensokyo?
Well then, I would like to return to my hometown while we are here, then. Sakuya, make preparations for a trip to Romania.
Haah, how I do wish my name was renowned as the great Vlad Tepes!
Tell me, Sakuya - this is the human world, is it not?
Flandre is my little sister. She's quite a troubling girl, but I cherish her regardless.
I'm not a lightweight when it comes to drinking. It's just my vampiric metabolism.
Look, I don't immediately hate all non-vampires, okay? I just have high standards.
For those of you who haven't figured it out, Sakuya can stop time and still move around freely.
You may still have several layers to go, but do not get conceited, human.
Do you expect me to comment on each and every insignificant occurrence in this game?
There is only so much I am willing to say about such a paltry sight.
I sure do hope the Mansion doesn't end up in flames or anything while we're out.
Now that I think about it, I hope that thieving witch doesn't show up at the Mansion today.
It'd be quite problematic if Flandre decides to act up while we are out.
I certainly hope Satori's sister doesn't decide to pay a visit today.
One by one, the pieces continue to come off.
Another round, another loss for you all.
Off comes another layer, it seems.
Are you beginning to notice a worrying trend?
(W-what's he planning now, taking off his ~clothing~ like that?)
(It's only his ~clothing~... no, there's more to it than that-!)
I know I've lost the game, but I still expect to be entertained while I'm here.
Could you hurry this up? I would prefer to get to the more interesting turns of this game.
She has a tendency to lose control, however, which is why Sakuya had to leave this game and restrain her.
Vampires get drunk quite suddenly, but we flush it out of our systems quite quickly too.
I-I'm actually quite simple. As long as you impress me, you can get on my good side.
She's human, too. Even you low creatures can become something wonderful. Don't slack off, okay?
You are but a man, no more than a miserable little pile of secrets.
I can tell at a glance, you can hardly keep that up for more than a few seconds. What weak control of your powers!

state.text: What, now you decide to hold your tongue? Is this some kind of elaborate prank?

case.state: I sure do hope the Mansion doesn't end up in flames or anything while we're out.
Now that I think about it, I hope that thieving witch doesn't show up at the Mansion today.
It'd be quite problematic if Flandre decides to act up while we are out.
I certainly hope Satori's sister doesn't decide to pay a visit today.
Enjoy this victory while it lasts, plebeians, and pray that I forget this humiliation before we meet again.
You will get no respect from me for winning at a mere poker game, peon.
Surely you can afford to take off something more important with a lead like that...
Are you lacking in confidence? You have far too large a lead to worry so much about how much you bare in front of us...
W-what? Like I said, I have nothing more to say!
I said this does not warrant a comment from myself!
Move on. Now.
Well, as long as Patchouli is there, the mansion should be fine.
As long as that gatekeeper does her job like she should, we won't have any problems.
Not to say you don't do a good job training them, Sakuya, but I do wish our fairy maids were combat capable.
Do you feel it? That creeping sense of dread?
There's no shame in conceding now. It'll save me some time, after all.
This is the power of inevitability, commoner.
Let me give you some advice, peon; you shouldn't let these failures pile up so quickly, ufufu.

(W-who would make such a big deal about that!? It has to be a trick of some sort!)
(I-I have to advert my eyes-! Who knows what kind of lewd magic that man can cast!)
(A seemingly innocent move at first, but there is definitely an impure motive behind it all!)
Now then, can we get back to something more interesting?
What. Is. It. Now. Saint?
You are testing my patience, Saint...
That is correct. It isn't as difficult as it initially seems, Milady. Your issue is that your danmaku tends to carve right through most surfaces.
Simpler minds may be amused by this little show of yours, but I am not so easily entertained.
Perhaps you should ask your grandfather, Vlad, to tell you stories about her.
What, it was merely decorative? No functions at all?

state.text: Saint, Pope, Messiah, they all mean very little to me.

case.state: She is undoubtedly better than most of the fairy maids in the Mansion.
I would say that she's a little too... ill-mannered, to take a servile role.
It's not blood? How do you explain the scent of iron, then?
Oh? Your world has a need to regulate its magic?
It's a way of settling disputes in a elegant and tasteful manner, as well as monitoring the citizens' powers.
Their tendency towards violence, utter disregard for their own kind, reckless and self-destructive nature...
I could probably do the same with my danmaku, but I would need to control my strength quite a lot to do so.
You are, without a doubt, more competent than most of the fairy maids I have under my employ.
I'm sure if Sakuya was still here, she would be asking me, "Isn't this maid far too cheeky?"

Are you beginning to notice a worrying trend?

I know I've lost the game, but I still expect to be entertained while I'm here.
Could you hurry this up? I would prefer to get to the more interesting turns of this game.
If you so much as utter another word, no, another syllable pertaining to my lineage I won't merely cut you down, Miko, I will live purely to grant you the most horrible fate I can possible find.
Why bother tempering my blows to achieve some bizarre gimmick? I much prefer a frontal approach, anyway.
Couldn't you have made a more complex pattern? I could dodge that with my eyes closed.
...that is, if he'll tell you about her. I'm not sure it's something he'd want you to know, ufufu.
Well, there are residents of Gensokyo who had adorned themselves with stranger things, so I suppose that is fine.

state.text: Oh? By the looks of it, it appears you have brought along a handmaid of your own, Pope.

case.state: Although, that in itself is hardly an impressive statement. I'm sure anyone with a brain would be more competent than those buffoons.
Nonsense, Sakuya. You can't expect everyone to be as perfect and elegant as you are.
Flesh of metal and blood of fuel. What an oddity you are, girl. I'm sure the kappa would love to take a look at you.
Are the denizens of your world so incompetent that they need to be babysat like that? I pity you somewhat, goddess.
I have no issues discussing the specifics after the game. Humans do come up with some interesting ideas on occasion, no?
Some exemplary humans do exist, such as Sakuya. But you are right - they are foolish, barbaric beings, aren't they?
I'd say that some would find that sort of behaviour quite endearing. Sakuya certainly is reliable, but she can be far too stoic at times.
I sure do hope the Mansion doesn't end up in flames or anything while we're out.

state.text: Cease your blabbering, you fool. You seem to be enthralled by the idea, but what is a man?

case.state: It isn't as if you're so far ahead that there's anything to brag about, peon.
Are you feeling confident, with all those layers to spare?
What now? Are you removing your ~clothing~?
To only be removing your ~clothing~ this late into the game...
To be forced to remove a major item already...
Are you starting to run out of baubles, commoner?
It appears you can stall for no longer, peasant.
You may hide no longer, peon.
It appears you have to remove something of value now. A shame... for you.
You have held out well, lowborn, but not well enough.
There are no trinkets left, peasant.
And so, the real game finally begins.
Oho? It seems this game is finally getting interesting.
You've finally decided to do something worthy of my attention!
Winning my attention by losing the round? A bold strategy, to be sure.
You have earned my attention, yes, but not my admiration. Not yet, I would hope.
I'm glad to see that I haven't been wasting my time playing this game.
Now this appears to be worth my time.
Ah, yes, it seems the game is finally progressing.
This is something that I can enjoy.
No, please, go on. Do not mind me.
Now then, this game is finally going somewhere.
It appears the tide of fate is changing.
The gears of fate continue to turn.
Just as one cannot flee their own shadow, you would be foolish to run away from your fate.
An individual cog in a machine cannot go against the flow of the world around them.
A leaf caught in the wind has no control over the direction it flies.
Humans have quite a wonderful saying, that "all roads lead to Rome".
Time lurches forward, regardless of whether you would like it to or not.
You are but a gnat caught in the web of destiny.
(Something l-like his ~clothing~!?)
(Oh, is it... his ~clothing~!?)
Something large is coming off now? Excellent.
This is much more enjoyable than seeing little trinkets come off.
I appreciate that you have gotten quite into the spirit of the game, at this point.
Off comes another unneeded piece of clothing.
Dealer. Continue the game. I wish to have this over with as soon as possible.
Be glad I am showing tolerance towards your gloating for now, peasants, but don't push your luck.
(Tch. I would have much preferred him to lose an inner layer...)
(It's a start, but couldn't he remove more than just that?)
You are beginning to teeter close to the edge.
Please try to provide at least some degree of challenge to me.
This outcome was inevitable. Do not act so surprised.
You are slowly running out of time.
This may be a game, but perhaps you should take it a little more seriously?
I question whether you're taking this game seriously or not.
Do you get a kick out of losing? Or are you just terrible at this?
Have you ever played this before? Stripping is considered to be losing, you know?
It is an admirable start. I do hope, however, that you keep this up.
Keep this up, and I may even commit your name to memory.
Your efforts are admirable, commoner. Perhaps you will be able to entertain me after all.
Did I tell you to stop? ... Well, I suppose it would be improper for me to dictate the rules of the game...
Will you not continue? I was enjoying that.
Perhaps I should reward you for that wonderful display?
Ufufu, wonderful.
Do that more often. This is an order, not a request.
It appears you plebeians are useful for more than a quick snack.
Your display was... acceptable.
Give up, peon, and embrace your destiny.
Don't bother fighting it, this loss was written in fate.
Some would say fate works in mysterious ways. I would disagree.
